channel.title: Do women have an adequate support network to help sustain a successful marriage?
channel.description: It seems that today there are more and more women getting divorces or unhappy in their marriages. Relationship expert Shere Hite estimated that 97% of married women are unhappy in their marriages. So if you combine that with the 50 percent of women who marry that file for divorce, that would suggest that 99% of women are unhappy with marriage. So who can a married woman turn to for encouragement and positive support of her marriage? Are the only happily married women the ones who have been married for less than a few years?

item.title: Do women have an adequate support network to help sustain a successful marriage?
item.dc:creator: vivanto
item.description:
SURPLUS_NiNjA:

Yes your right, take how long you have been a part of the community (joined) and then subtract it by how long you were a useless person with nothing better to do but read other peoples conversations (lurker) and you get how valuable a member of this forum you are.

If your definition of “being a valuable member of the community” is being a dick on forums, then by all means you’re definitely right. I’m sure you weren’t yet again just a random person with nothing better to do, than to read-and-reply to my post.

Oh the irony.

Read full topic
item.source: Do women have an adequate support network to help sustain a successful marriage?
